result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amicael Zapata

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amicael Zapata in court.  Attorney John j Forrestal in court for Amicael Zapata.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requested adjournment due to family member with illness. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 16; IN PERSON. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Amicael Zapata in court with attorney John j Forrestal.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Annie Louk for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned for a Plea/ Sentencing hearing to Br 16.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Amicael Zapata in court with Attorney John j Forrestal via zoom.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  The status conference was held OFF THE RECORD via zoom.  Defense request a plea hearing .  The court grants defense request.  The court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 16 via zoom for Plea hearing on 6/27/22 at 1:30pm

Defendant Amicael Zapata in court with Attorney John j Forrestal via zoom.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held OFF THE RECORD.  Defense has discovery and the State's offer requesting additional time to review the material with his client.  The Court granted defense request.  
The matter is adjourned back to Branch 16 via zoom.
  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Amicael Zapata in court with attorney John j Forrestal.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amicael Zapata appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom. 
Case assigned to incorrect court. Case transferred to Branch 16. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in branch 16.
  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Davis, Br. 21.

Defendant Amicael Zapata in court with Attorney John J Forrestal.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 21, Judge Davis. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Amicael Zapata in court with attorney John j Forrestal.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on January 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/26/22 @ 1:30p
